metadata.title: CVE-2022-0854 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s DMA subsystem, in theway a user calls DMA_FROM_DEVICE. This flaw allows a local user to readrandom memory from the kernel space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1149-azure - 4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1149.164~14.04.1').
